[[File:Letter to Harry C. Bauer.jpg: On [[24 November]] [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
thumb]]: a letter]] to Professor Harry C. Bauer'''.<ref group=note>Harry Charles Bauer (1902-1978), born in St. Louis, Missouri, was a graduate of  the St. Louis Library School. Bauer served as a professor of library science at the University of Washington. (Source: [http://content.lib.washington.edu/cdm4/item_viewer.php?CISOROOT=/portraits&CISOPTR=231 Digital Collections: Harry C. Bauer and Lulu Fairbanks examining the Eric A. Hegg photograph albums, n.d.], at [http://www.lib.washington.edu/ University Libraries, University of Washington] (accessed 17 August 2013).)</ref><ref name=Sac>{{webcite

[[File:Letter to Harry C. Bauer.jpg: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien thanks Bauer for an article or reprint Bauer had sent him. While the text Bauer sent is unknown, [[John D. Rateliff]] has noted that "it must have had something to do with the work of [[Wikipedia:Sinclair Lewis
thumb]]: Sinclair Lewis]], since Tolkien immediately segues into saying that he is now inclined to think that the word ''[[Hobbits
column4: ''Babbitt'']]". Tolkien also states in the letter that "he read all of Sinclair Lewis" (apparently referring to Lewis's famous books).<ref name=Sac/>
